dialog.text: How do I stop self-doubt from paralyzing me?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: vulnerable, curious; Intonation: rising question; Speed: slightly slow; Tone: soft, earnest.

dialog.text: Start with tiny tests — micro-experiments, not big promises.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: calm, reassuring; Intonation: steady, clear; Speed: measured; Tone: warm, confident.

dialog.text: Micro-experiments? What does that even look like?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: puzzled, hopeful; Intonation: questioning; Speed: moderate; Tone: light uncertainty.

dialog.text: Pick the smallest action you can imagine and time-box it — five minutes, ten seconds, one call.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: instructive; Intonation: deliberate, paced; Speed: moderate; Tone: practical, encouraging.

dialog.text: Like what? Give me examples I can actually do.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: eager; Intonation: quick, expectant; Speed: a bit faster; Tone: upbeat.

dialog.text: Send a single message you’ve been avoiding. Record a ten‑second clip. Sketch one idea, then stop.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: upbeat, motivating; Intonation: rhythmic; Speed: lively; Tone: encouraging.

dialog.text: Will tiny things really change how I feel about myself?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: skeptical but wanting to believe; Intonation: soft, rising; Speed: moderate; Tone: tentative.

dialog.text: Yes. I froze before speaking publicly — my first micro‑experiment was a 20‑second voice note to a friend. It felt ridiculous and enormous at once.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: reflective, honest; Intonation: warm, slightly nostalgic; Speed: measured; Tone: relatable, intimate.
Accent: neutral; Emotional range: curious; Intonation: rising; Speed: moderate; Tone: hopeful.

dialog.text: I survived it. I learned what made my voice shake, then tried a different 20 seconds. Each tiny try gave me evidence: doubt was a feeling, not a fact.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: steady, reassuring; Intonation: confident; Speed: measured; Tone: calm, persuasive.

dialog.text: So if I fail, it’s not the end — it’s just data?
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: anxious then reassured; Intonation: questioning then hopeful; Speed: moderate; Tone: thoughtful.

dialog.text: Exactly. Treat failure as information: note what changed, tweak the experiment, try again. Five small experiments stack into momentum.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: encouraging, pragmatic; Intonation: rhythmic, building; Speed: steady; Tone: motivational.

dialog.text: Okay — I’ll try one tiny thing today.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: resolved, nervous optimism; Intonation: determined; Speed: moderate; Tone: bright.

dialog.text: Do one micro‑experiment now. Spend five minutes, notice what happens, then tell us in the comments — what you tried and what you learned. Small data, big change.
dialog.instructions: Accent: neutral; Emotional range: energetic, invitational; Intonation: encouraging call to action; Speed: upbeat; Tone: warm, compelling.
